result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Glen Benage was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Counts 4 and 5 concurrent with each other and with 21CF617 and 21CF957.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea/sentencing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:19 AM Defendant Michael Glen Benage in court by video with attorney Steven W. Zaleski by video. Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 4 and 5. Court finds the Defendant guilty on counts 4 and 5.  Counts 1-3 are dismissed and read in. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 18 months prison and 30 months extended supervision on each count concurrent with each other and concurrent with 21CF957 and 21CF617.  Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program. Costs DOC collect. Sentence credit 72 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2022 at 10:15 am.
INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

2:40 PM Defendant Michael Glen Benage in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Steven W. Zaleski by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set, bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on May 9, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Court Appointed Attorney Payment Information

Defendant to reimburse County $30 per month for court appointed attorney fees. Preliminary hearing hearing requested by zoom. Time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Court Appointed Attorney
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Reimbursement amount to be set at next hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:13 PM Defendant Michael Glen Benage in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Kevin M Smith and legal intern Olivia Long appearing by video.  Emmeline Lee   and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, address verified, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.   Cash bond set of $1,000.00   with conditions. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  No contact directly or indirectly with victims A.R.S. or R.M.P. his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except for one time trip with law enforcement to retrieve personal belongings. Matter continued to allow defendant to contact Public Defenders office. Adjourned initial appearance March 29, 2022 at 3:00 pm.
